summary: The activity schedule-to-start latency metric incorrectly reports high values during retries because it uses the original activity scheduled time instead of the current attempt's scheduled time.
userImpact: Users cannot accurately measure worker queue depth using the schedule-to-start latency metric when activities are retried, as the metric reports inflated values.
rootCause: The SDK calculates schedule-to-start latency using the activity's initial scheduled time rather than the current attempt's scheduled time, causing retried attempts to report the full time since the original scheduling.
proposedFix: Use current_attempt_scheduled_time from the activity task instead of the initial scheduled time for calculating the metric.
resolutionDetails: Corrected to use current_attempt_scheduled_time instead of initial scheduled time for retried activity attempts, aligning with other SDK implementations.
keyQuote: after checking other SDKs, looks like they're using the `current_attempt_scheduled_time`.
